Examination of chromosome numbers and cytological features indicates that M. indica and M. sylvatica have the same chromosome number (n=20) (Nishiyama et al. 2006; Mukherjee 1950; Mukharjee 1957) indicating a close relationship between the two species.
Coconut is one of the few major crop species that has no closely related wild relatives. Likely the wild progenitor has been subsumed by the cultivated crop

Precise information on the distribution and extent of wild date palm populations is entirely lacking. However the sister species is able to hybridize with Phoenix dactylifera although wild progenitor populations have been found in Oman these still bear the name Phoenix dactylifera.
